item.title: IMF calls on China to cut industrial subsidies in half — 110 replies — 352.3/hr
item.content:encoded:
IMF calls on China to cut industrial subsidies in half

Open thread • Replies: 110 • Updated: 2026-02-20 19:30 UTC

OP

Early replies (first 3)

61872971
>>61872964
This is a strategic move by the Chinese to kill off the competition in other countries so the Chinese companies can dominate the sectors and then raise the prices

61872974
i'm sure china will get right on that

61872978
jews mad
>>61872971
they can do it forever without raising the prices

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61877115
>>61875572
>>61875564
>>61874440

I sincerely hope you're just too young or pol-brained to know any better, but just in case you aren't:

The Chinese state does not give out money (or make sure other financiers are available to give out money) in order to create productive, competitive industry. They do it for 2 reasons:
>It lets them massively overproduce a good (solar panels, EVs, E-bikes, ect...) at a loss in order to crush foreign manufacturing bases and corner the production
>It helps ensure employment.

Half the reason for the boondoggle that has been OBOR is that it meant the Chinese could use central Asia as a dumping ground for all of the dogshit concrete and steel they were churning out at a loss for years. There wasn't an appetite for that much material when they were making it, and they knew it. Export profits were not the point.

The 2nd point is the bigger deal. Basically, for a long time, the deal in China was that so long as the average guy could get a job if he wanted one, and didn't make too much noise, things would get better. The CCP revolution that conquered the country was built on jobless, angry people, and the guys running the CCP did not want to be on the other end of that deal. Therefore, the CCP is willing to subsidize terrible business that are guaranteed to lose money, so long as they can promise jobs. The problem these days is that youth unemployment is high and climbing and the increasingly small share of the Chinese population that is young is more and more dissatisfied with living in a PvE server as the E.

>61876817
>best at everything that matters
What a funny way to say, "polluted their soil, water, and air so thoroughly that not even their party members are able to avoid bone marrow cancer anymore." You would think that they would just incinerate the waste solvents from all the REE processing like Victorian industrialists, but I guess it was 0.000003 RMB cheaper per ton to just dump it into the nearest waterway.

61877159
>>61877115
Ameri fat Kool aid
USAID mental gymnastics

61877162
>>61877115
>OBOR boondoggle
opinion discarded. Remain uninformed and get fucked.
I don't know why low info retards like you are so confident and unaware to the point of spending time typing out that trash.

61877164
>>61877115
>What a funny way to say, "polluted their soil, water, and air so thoroughly that not even their party members are able to avoid bone marrow cancer anymore." You would think that they would just incinerate the waste solvents from all the REE processing like Victorian industrialists, but I guess it was 0.000003 RMB cheaper per ton to just dump it into the nearest waterway.
lol
what a funny way to cope with living in a country that can't make hdmi cables

61877170
>just pollute the water bros!!
>we will break chinese REE monopoly in no time!!!!

61877198
>>61873794
esl subhumans once again on an american website.

61877206
Uh-oh l didn't realize we were all just supposed to go along with the 'china wise like 1000 year old fish' retardation. Fucking spare me. We're talking about a place that has regular catastrophic flooding on a river its people have continually inhabited and farmed for over 3000 years.

>They will scream, they will cry, they will seethe
>but they will never talk about ROI on that rail road/highway combo that was supposed to cross the most economically desolate strip of earth possible to connect "where?" with "who cares?".
>A country that still cannot manage to make etchants more complicated than RCA cleans is gonna totally dominate semiconductors

The really fun environmental whoopsie they did recently was related to cadmium and arsenic uptake. Cotton was being grown in fields contaminated with heavy metals, which is relatively fine since the fibers won't get consumed. Then the order came down to convert cotton fields to grain. The only reason that anyone noticed a problem is that cadmium poisoning causes rapid onset joint pain.

But none of that can top the hilarity of deleting literally millions of infants between 1980 and 2015, then turning around and being utterly shocked at running out of young people.

61877210
>>61877206
we're talking about the only place that can make hdmi cables

61877217
>cotton fields
are all in Xinjiang, which btw produces the absolute best cotton in the world.
>growing grains in Xinjiang
ror
rmao even
do you even read what you wrote and see how retarded you sound?

61877223
>environmental protection
>in 2026
Are we really going to pretend that this matters at all anymore? Look at who's the fucking president. Look at what he's doing to the EPA.

And if Europe wants to have competitive manufacturing again, they'll likely lax regulations too.

I don't like it either, a lot of people are going to get fucked. However competitive manufacturing means slashing prices, which means ignoring everything that doesn't show up on a quarterly report.

61877619
>>61872964
Instead of wasting money on niggers, China subsidizes real businesses that make things?
IMF Jews are seething.

61877897
>>61876817
I am not arguing that China doesn’t produce essential goods. I am trying to explain how these conditions happened. While there are tons of reasons that Chinese manufacturing rose to prominence—huge cheap labor force that was previously kept away from foreign investment, America putting China on the MFN list—a consistently cheap currency is one of them, hence why they have been accused of currency manipulation for literal decades.

>Currency can ligma balls or be infinitely expensive compared to other currencies, it does not matter. It may seem that it does, but it does not.
This is just patently untrue. Obviously, if China’s currency were infinitely expensive, which would be the equivalent to having a self-imposed trade embargo, nobody would buy their products. What you would see is the rapid expansion of the industries that China has a monopoly on; a part of the reason that these industries do not pop up elsewhere is that potential manufacturers know that it’s difficult to compete with how cheap Chinese goods are, so why bother.

You seem to genuinely believe that exchange rates do not ultimately matter in trade, which simply ignores how international trade functions. I’ll give you another example. After WWII, the US set Japan’s exchange rate intentionally low as a part of the Dodge Plan because they wanted a democratic stronghold in Asia, and they knew giving them a cheaper currency would help their export market. This worked TOO WELL. Over the course of the next forty years, Japan became so dominant in the export market that other countries began to panic and they “renegotiated” the exchange rate again at the plaza accords (this would have disastrous effects). If we were in the 80’s, you would point to Japan and say that “look at all the great products they make. It doesn’t matter what their exchange rate is,” and that would ignore the conditions that gave rise to their export dominance in the first place.

61878109
>>61872971
Doesn't help them a bit. The chink economy is still in a deflationary death spiral and there is no way in hell its ever going to get out.

61878121
>>61876956
Lmfao. You can produce whatever you want, when demand dies as it has for the last 6 years you are going to sit on overproduction. Add a corrupt communist bureaucratic political party tyranny that plays same asset re-leveraged ponzi to increase its monetary base you get economic deflation and monetary hyperinflation - that's the perfect breeding ground for insurgency

The ccp and Chinese bureaucrats and polity is going to be slaughtered in the streets

61878126
>>61878121

61878133
>>61878126

China is dead and has been for the better part of 13 years. All the corruption and attempts to paint over the political and economic failures are now coming home all at the same time. There won't be a "people" 'republic' of China by 2030

61878137
>>61878133
I think you're Indian.

61878138
>>61878133

61878148
>>61878137
>>61878138
Wumaos
When the checks stop coming you gone. The rest of the country is going to slaughter you

61878155
>>61878148
>When the checks stop coming you gone
Confirmed Indian

61878160
>>61878155
Wumao, who do you think is first going to be rationalized away? You or chair man chang? You gonna die chink

61878162
>>61878109
They made a bet that reaching out infrastructure to the hundreds of millions of people of low-productivity regions could improve domestic demand to the extent that their subsidies start to be consumed internally. The problem is that the low-productivity areas are, of course, low income and the only two options which exist to them are:
>Direct UBI for low-income areas
>Creating even more highly subsidized factories to employ low-income people and give them a better wage
Honestly for them the UBI route is likely more cost-effective, to avoid further deflating the value of the plants they already have. The 3rd (much) more challenging and expensive option would be to migrate the sweat-shops and low-skill factories out to the countryside from bigger city centers and reassign the existing factories to high-tech, high-skill plants such as chip foundries and advanced component manufacturing. To a certain extent they're being forced into this already due to sanctions etc on high-end chips, but if it's their primary gameplan then it's progressing way too slowly. Modernizing a billion people (bugs) is a hell of a project

61878168
>>61878160
You're stinking up the thread.

61878171
>>61878162
>UBI
That's the funny part, the polity as the bureaucracy as the socialist "billionaire" bastards that rely on the continuation of the sovereign bond ponzis are going to hang on the same gallows

61878316
>>61878171
Are you ESL? I feel like I got schizophrenia just from reading your post

61880069
>>61874731
>17% of the US population who are hooked on SSRIs get their supplies cut off, along with the active ingredients we buy from them for everything else. We lost the bio-warfare game before it even began.

61880124
>>61875629
Everything done by a government can be construed as being a subsidy

Good infrastructure is a subsidy
Skilled workforce is a subsidy
Low crime rate is a subsidy
Friendly regulatory environment is a subsidy
Low cost of living for employees is a subsidy
Ease of worker relocation and efficient job matching is a subsidy
Low taxes due to government thrift is a subsidy
Etc

61880265
>>61873120
On the world though? Also where would China be without Amazon and Walmart like worse than Thailand.

61880291
>>61875302
>If a basket of various goods in the US goes for 100 dollars and that same basket of goods in Vietnam goes for 10 dollars (ALL ELSE BEING EQUAL), then a fair exchange rate would be 10 dong for one dollar
That is a made up rule. There is no fundamental reason for why 1 dong should have the same purchasing power as 1 dollar. Currency units are just made up. Vietnam could introduce a new currency superunit called the bong, say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar. That would satisfy your rule while also de facto maintaining the current exchange rate.

There is a natural reason for why the basket is cheaper in dollar terms in Vietnam, which is the Balassa-Samuelson effect

>There’s a reason why economists or even someone casually interested in the economy and trade policy use these terms.
Yes, because they are shills trying to find arguments for why China should make Chinese companies less competitive and/or arguments for why tariffs should be imposed against China. It's really all just to protect the profits of domestic companies

61880312
>>61880291
>say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar.
*say 1 bong is equal to 2,597 dong and also that 10 bong are equal to 1 dollar

But it's entirely antithetical to a leftist world view that basically identifies everyone as either victims and victimizers and that rustled Jimmies.
